comments:
Statistics 102 is a continuation of STAT 101.  It will teach a thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, linear logistic regression, and introduction to time series with business applications.  

There were mixed reviews about the course.  While some thought it was very applicable and the material was interesting and useful, others felt they didn’t learn much.  One student said that you “learn useful skills in multivariate methods, but the process is boring and unclear.”

Most students felt Professor Zhao was hard to understand.  Otherwise, there were mixed reviews.  Some said she made the course “extremely fun and engaging,” while others said she was “highly unprofessional and horrible at communicating the subject matter.” One student felt that Professor Zhao was qualified, but “tended to go over the material very quickly.”

Students felt the homework took a long time to complete, and had mixed reviews about the difficulty level of the homework.  One said that “the homework grading was sometimes kind of weird, but was pretty fair.”  Sometimes the due date for homework was set to the day before a quiz or exam. This class is part of the Wharton core. The prerequisite for this course is STAT 101.
